metadata.title: CVE-2018-6171 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Use after free in Bluetooth in Google Chrome prior to 68.0.3440.75 allowedan attacker who convinced a user to install a malicious extension to obtainpotentially sensitive information from process memory via a crafted ChromeExtension.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6171` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0.3440.75-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
